bug.short_desc: No warning for unused generic parameters

long_desc.thetext: Can you please elaborate on the motivation behind this and the advantages of eliminating unused type parameters? Also, what if some other class is overriding a class which hasn't used its type parameter and then using the type parameter in some way?

(In reply to comment #1) > Can you please elaborate on the motivation behind this and the advantages of > eliminating unused type parameters? Also, what if some other class is > overriding a class which hasn't used its type parameter and then using the type > parameter in some way?
This latter point should be irrelevant ? If the class definition does not reference the type variable, there is no parameterization happening using the type variable and the type variable could be removed ?

The motivation behind this is almost the same as that behind the unused parameter warnings in methods. It makes the code less cluttered, more readable, prevents propagating unnecessary objects (types in this case) throughout the rest of the code.
Sometimes when refactoring, I've eliminated one or more generic parameters and forgotten to remove it from the class/method declaration.
We'll revisit this post the completion of java 8 work.

Created attachment 221825 Patch
Patch for Bug 385780 - No warning for unused generic parameters (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=385780)
- Main Algorithm: Piggybacking on the flow analysis for deprecated type, the Used flag is set for the referenced type parameter, which is consumed at the analyseCode to flag a {warning, error, <or_ignore>} for unused generic type parameters. - Added a new warning in the error reporting machinery under unnecessary code bucket. - Test Framework modified mainly for a)addition for test at GenericRegressionTest and b) a minor addition of ignoring this warning/error for all generic type test cases.
To check: Eclipse Preferences api/interface in UI ?

Created attachment 221874 Proposed Patch
Modified version of the earlier patch

Markus, this was chosen as an entry level bug for Manoj to work on. I meant to, but forgot to ask if you would support this in the UI and if I should raise a bug for that - we don't have a timeline in mind. Perhaps this could be an exercise for the new UI engineer on training and could make it to 4.3 ?

(In reply to comment #6)
> Modified version of the earlier patch
The fix looks good. The following is laundry list of administrative matter related comments - naming conventions, coding conventions, formatting and indentation comments etc, that usually shows up in reviews of new engineers: Please address them and repost a fresh patch.
- "unusedGenericType" is an inappropriate description. The diagnostic is about unused type parameter and not unused type.
- The default value should be set to warning and not ignore. I think you copied this part from unused parameter. There is a reason why it is set to ignore in that case. A particular implementation of a method may not use a parameter, while it is used by the super type's implementation or a subtype's implementation. The unused parameter cannot in this case cannot be removed without breaking the inheritance hierarchy and so many times these warnings if they are produced by default will turn out to be unactionable. Hence the ignore setting for them.
- GenericRegressionTests: 1. The copyright update at each bug level is not required for IBM contributors. Any new file should carry the umbrell copy right text that mentions IBM anyway. 2. Please get rid of all noise diffs from this file, no new blank lines, commented static block updates etc should be there. 3. I would remove this comment: //bug 385780 - new warning should not disrupt other tests 4. junit attempts to run all methods that start with "test" - So helper method test385780_helper_setup should not be named that. I would actually get rid of this method altogether just to be in conformance with overall style. The usual practice is to simply update the map in place. 5. Where possible, the convention is simply name the test file X.java. 6. Please get rid of the lines: if (this.complianceLevel < ClassFileConstants.JDK1_5) return; GenericRegressionTests will never be run at compliance levels below 1.5. 7. Tests test385780c and test385780d look identical ?? 8. Negative tests must produce an error - test385780e should be changed to do that. The traditional way of doing this is to introduce a variable declaration Zork z; which will make it a negative test. The artificially introduced error should not be a syntax error, it should be a semantic error like suggested since syntax errors trigger error recovery which can make the expected output fragile against grammar changes. Also syntax errors inhibit various classes of errors. 9. I would merge all these tests into one. All you need to make sure is that there is only one public type. - The patch incorrectly includes your local changes to org.eclipse.jdt.core.preferences. The effect of releasing this code is that you are making this setting an error for JDT/Core developers. - ASTNode: I would remove the comment: //if TypeParameter then mark Used The code is self explanatory. We can leave in the bug number. - Likewise in ConstructorDeclaration: // Consume Used Flag - I would change for (int i = 0; i<this.typeParameters.length; ++i) { to for (int i = 0, length = this.typeParameters.length; i < length; ++i) { Two points here: We want to pull up the loop invariant code for length computation out of the loop since this is an optimization our compiler does not perform. Also notice spaces around '<' - No need to change present code, but TypeParameter variables are usually named typeParameter. All you need to is after the type name has been keyed in or completed, hit ctrl-space to see variable names suggested for you. tp is good enough for this case. - )==0 ==> ) == 0 - Same line & is preceded by two spaces while it should be only one. - if hasSyntaxError should be pulled outside the loop. - Similar cleanups in MethodDeclaration and TypeDeclaration. - ProblemReporter#unusedGenericType creates four objects, while just one would do. - Why would the javadoc for COMPILER_PB_UNUSED_GENERIC_TYPE mention the bug number ? did you notice this somewhere else ? I am not familiar with a such a need/convention. - unused Generic Type Parameter ==> unused generic type parameter. - We have a requirement that javadoc changes must be validated by W3C's html validator. - Always terminating the last element of array initializer with a , is a good practice. This allows you to add further entries, move them around etc - See OPTION_ReportUnusedGenericType in CompilerOptions - IrritantSet: Adding .set(CompilerOptions.UnusedGenericType) above RedundantSpecificationOfTypeArguments reduces the delta size by 50% :)
I still need to review CompilerOptions & IrritantSet closely. I will do that after these issues are addressed.

Created attachment 222007 Proposed Patch
Patch reworked with the comments. By default the state is "ignored".

(In reply to comment #7) I agree the feature makes sense and we should add UI for it. A bug for JDT UI would be great.
(In reply to comment #9) Manoj: This feature is very similar to CompilerOptions.OPTION_ReportUnusedParameter. Please perform a search for references to that constant and then see where it makes sense to add similar code for the new OPTION_ReportUnusedTypeParameter.
E.g. Main#handleErrorOrWarningToken(..) should: - add a command line switch - handle it in the "unused" command line argument
Once the feature is complete, we also need to add documentation in task-using_batch_compiler.htm .

Patch looks good. A few more corrections:
- GRT: Please get rid of the first diff. - JavaCore.java: please get rid of the copyright change. - JavaCore.java: Please get rid of bug 385780 from the javadoc - We need a test for generic constructors. - org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.batch.Main.handleErrorOrWarningToken(String, boolean, int) is not processing this option. i.e if the new token is provided in the batch compiler command line it will be ignored. (Search for uses of OPTION_ReportUnusedPrivateMember in non-tests and the use of the new option should match the uses of that)
- Likewise in org.eclipse.jdt.internal.formatter.DefaultCodeFormatter.getDefaultCompilerOptions()
Please always eyeball the patch to make sure there are no noise diffs etc.

(In reply to comment #10) > (In reply to comment #7) > I agree the feature makes sense and we should add UI for it. A bug for JDT > UI would be great.
Manoj, please raise an enhancement request against JDT/UI:
"UI support requested for diagnosing unused type parameters" and mention this bug number there - TIA. (bug xxxxxx format enables hyperlinks in bugzilla).

(In reply to comment #11)
> option. i.e if the new token is provided > in the batch compiler command line it will be ignored.
BTW, need a test for the batch compiler too in org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler.regression.BatchCompilerTest

(In reply to comment #14) > Created attachment 222153 [details] > Proposed Patch
- Please get rid of the first diff (noise) in GRT. - We need a specific batch compiler test that uses the new token in the command line. - Main.java: in the line }else if (token.equals("unusedTypeParameter")) { //$NON-NLS-1$ //$NON-NLS-2$ setSeverity(CompilerOptions.OPTION_ReportUnusedTypeParameter, severity, isEnabling); return; (a) introduce a space before "else if" to keep it consistent. (b) The //$NON-NLS-2$ tag is wrong ! there is a warning also in that line that shows it is wrong. (c) This block is coded twice in the same method - Why ? - Please change all //https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=385780 so there is a leading space before the https - sorry to nitpick. - JavaCore.java: javadoc is ending abruptly at "whenever it encounters an unused"
